root: ^But I can't just keep being sad. Or confused.
^It's okay to be sad sometimes. You know that, right?
^Being sad isn't productive, though. I keep crying like my life is over, but it isn't over.
^I'm alive, so I might as well make the most of being alive.
^I never wanted this to happen, but I always wanted a chance to lead. So now I can step up and help us through this.
^I think you might be going too fast...
^If the other option is wasting time, then I'd rather be fast.
^Steven, you need to give yourself time to mourn.
^I know, and I did. But I keep thinking about what affects me and not what affects the carnival. I'm done being selfish.

s: ^Everyone else needs time to mourn, too.

Choice1: ^Maybe not. But I can still be productive. People deserve a happy carnival.
^Sure, but is that what they need? Being happy isn't a choice. They can be happy again with time.
Choice2: ^People come here to be happy, not sad. I can help make them happy again.
Done: ^I get it. Thinking about what to do next can make the present less scary and sad.
^It gets your mind off things, and you think you feel better. But that feeling is temporary and you only end up hiding your sadness.
